intro: Meiandra, commonly known as the sacred lotus of Southeast Asia, is a flowering plant belonging to the Malvaceae family. It is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that bloom in shades of pink, white, and red. The plant has large, heart-shaped leaves that float on the surface of water, while its roots grow submerged in aquatic environments. Meiandra is often cultivated in ponds and gardens for its ornamental value and cultural significance. It plays an important role in traditional medicine and spiritual practices in many Asian cultures.
